page.title: 05Petworth Cottage Hospital
page.content: The hospital is half a mile east from the centre of the town.It started as a hospital in 1867, when Lord Egremont's great, great grandmother handed it over. The people who work there are a cook, handyman, deputy matron, matron and 22 part time staff who work between 15 and 30 hours a week. The places which the patients come from are Bognor, Littlehampton, Chichester, Horsham and Haslemere as well as the Petworth area. The hospital is about 20 metres high and 29 metres wide. The staff look after the 23 patients there by giving them breakfast at 7.45, 10.30 coffee, 12.00 lunch, 3.00 tea, 6.00 supper and 8.30 hot drink.
